datasets.name: cell_subsampled.csv
datasets.description: This subsampled dataset contains detailed information on 490,232 mouse brain cells, including cell type classifications, spatial coordinates, neurotransmitter types, and visualization color codes, enabling the study of cell diversity, distribution, and functional characteristics.

raw.name: cell_barcode
raw.description: Unique identifier for each cell, used to differentiate individual cells within a mixed population.

raw.name: barcoded_cell_sample_label
raw.description: Label linking a barcode to a specific cell sample, indicating its source or experimental condition.

raw.name: library_label
raw.description: Identifier for the sequencing library batch, which is a collection of DNA fragments prepared for sequencing.

raw.name: feature_matrix_label
raw.description: Denotes the specific feature matrix used, which typically contains data such as gene expression levels across various cells.

raw.name: entity
raw.description: Represents the biological entity being studied, such as 'cell'.

raw.name: brain_section_label
raw.description: Label for the specific brain section from which the cell was isolated, relevant in studies of brain structure and function.

raw.name: library_method
raw.description: The technique or protocol used to prepare the sequencing library, such as 10Xv3

raw.name: region_of_interest_acronym
raw.description: Acronym for the specific region of interest within the biological sample, often used in neurobiology to refer to brain regions.

raw.name: donor_label
raw.description: Identifier for the donor from whom the biological sample was obtained, important for tracking genetic and phenotypic information.

raw.name: donor_genotype
raw.description: The genetic makeup of the donor, which can influence the characteristics of the cells derived from them.

raw.name: donor_sex
raw.description: The biological sex of the donor, which can be relevant in studies of sex-specific differences in biology.

raw.name: dataset_label
raw.description: Identifier for the dataset or experiment, useful for distinguishing between different experiments or data collections.

raw.name: x
raw.description: X-coordinate for spatial localization of the cell, used in spatial transcriptomics.

raw.name: y
raw.description: Y-coordinate for spatial localization of the cell, used in spatial transcriptomics.

raw.name: cluster_alias
raw.description: Alias for a group of cells that have been clustered together based on similar characteristics, such as gene expression profiles.

raw.name: neurotransmitter
raw.description: Type of neurotransmitter associated with the cell, indicating its role in neurotransmission and signaling in the nervous system.

raw.name: class
raw.description: Classification of the cell type, such as neuronal or glial.

raw.name: subclass
raw.description: Subclassification within the cell type, providing more detailed categorization.

raw.name: supertype
raw.description: Higher-level classification of the cell type, encompassing multiple subclasses.

raw.name: cluster
raw.description: Specific cluster designation for the cell, often used in analysis to group similar cells.

raw.name: neurotransmitter_color
raw.description: Color code for visualizing neurotransmitter type in data visualizations.

raw.name: class_color
raw.description: Color code for the cell class, used in visual representations.

raw.name: subclass_color
raw.description: Color code for the cell subclass, used in visual representations.

raw.name: supertype_color
raw.description: Color code for the cell supertype, used in visual representations.

raw.name: cluster_color
raw.description: Color code for the cell cluster, used in visual representations.

raw.name: region_of_interest_order
raw.description: Order of processing for regions of interest, potentially indicating a workflow or analysis sequence.

raw.name: region_of_interest_color
raw.description: Color code for visualizing regions of interest, used in data visualizations.

queries.question: Plot a stacked bar distribution graph for neurotransmitter in each class. Save the figure as 'neurotransmitter_distribution_13.png' in the current folder.
